sub_topic: Calculating the circumference of a circle.
message_1: What is the circumference of a circle if the radius is 7 centimeters? (Round your answer to two decimal places)
message_2:
The circumference of a circle is given by the formula C = 2πr, where C is the circumference and r is the radius.

Given the radius r = 7 centimeters, we can calculate the circumference as follows:

C = 2π(7)
C ≈ 2 × 3.14 × 7
C ≈ 43.96

The circumference of the circle is approximately 43.96 centimeters when rounded to two decimal places.
